content: - 18 scs round 4 *2 single_crochet in next single_crochet 1 single_crochet in each of the next 2 single_crochet repeat from * around - 24 scs round 5 *2 single_crochet in next single_crochet 1 single_crochet in each of the next 3 single_crochet repeat from * around - 30 scs round 6 * 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet 1 single_crochet in each of the next 4 single_crochet repeat from * around - 36 scs rnds 7-10 work even 36 single_crochet each round fasten_off leaving a long tail for sewing to bottom bottom with black start with an adjustable loop round 1 6 single_crochet in loop round 2 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around - 12 scs round 3 *2 single_crochet in next single_crochet 1 single_crochet in next single_crochet repeat from * around - 18 scs round 4 *2 single_crochet in next single_crochet 1 single_crochet in each of the next 2 single_crochet repeat from * around - 24 scs round 5 *2 single_crochet in next single_crochet 1 single_crochet in each of the next 3 single_crochet repeat from * around - 30 scs round 6 * 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet 1 single_crochet in each of the next 4 single_crochet repeat from * around - 36 scs fasten_off and weave in ends head with black start with an adjustable loop round 1 6 single_crochet in loop round 2 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around - 12 scs round 3 work even 12 single_crochet round 4 work even 12 single_crochet fasten_off leaving a tail long enough to sew head to body assembling using the black yarn-tail from the body sew bottom to body matching stitch for stitch about two-thirds of the way around stuff firmly with polyfill finish sewing around and fasten_off weaving in the end attach eyes to head stuff the head and sew it to the body cut 2 circles of desired size from the red felt and using the black embroidery thread sew to the body also embroider a line down the middle of the lady bug s back using the black embroidery thread cut two pieces of pipe cleaner about 3 inches long to shape in a spiral wrap one end of the pipe cleaner around a pencil a few times glue into the top of lady-bug s head you are finished and ready to play pattern information the contents of this pattern and the crocheted design within are subject to copyright you may use this pattern for personal and non-commercial purposes without express permission from the designer and copyright holder heliinä swerdlyk you may not distribute or sell electronic or paper copies of this pattern and though you may not sell any items produced using the directions or photographs in this pattern you are warmly encouraged to use this pattern for charitable purposes help is free and always available if you have any questions or comments about this pattern please email support@heliina com ©heliinä swerdlyk www heliina com
